  • Method Details

    • setScores

      public org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat setScores(PixelAnalysis pixelAnalysis, ColorCluster.ColorSchemaName colorSchemaName)
      Set the pixel scores using the other Mats from the PixelAnalysis object. A penalty Mat is calculated from the distance outside the range, and added to the Mat holding the distance from the target value. Lower scores mean higher similarity. distBelowThreshhold is not necessary because the minimum of all scores will be used, and this is only 1 of many potential scores matrices.
      Parameters:
      pixelAnalysis - the PixelAnalysis object to use
      colorSchemaName - the color schema to use
      Returns:
      the pixel scores

    • convertActionOptionsScoreToPixelAnalysisScoreWithTanh

      public double convertActionOptionsScoreToPixelAnalysisScoreWithTanh(double actionOptionsScore)
      The minScore in ActionOptions is not specific to the evaluation method. Each class that defines an evaluation method, such as this class, should also have a score conversion method. The minScore is adjusted so that it has an effect on the scores. Otherwise, all scores above 2 would be the same. tanh(3) = 0.9950547536867305 tanh(2) = 0.9640275800758169 tanh(1) = 0.7615941559557649 tanh(.83) = 0.7011682020026853 tanh(0) = 0
      Parameters:
      actionOptionsScore - the ActionOptions score to convert
      Returns:
      the maxScore for this class's evaluation method

    • convertActionOptionsScoreToPixelAnalysisScore

      public double convertActionOptionsScoreToPixelAnalysisScore(double actionOptionsScore)

    • convertPixelAnalysisScoreToActionOptionsScoreWithTanh

      public double convertPixelAnalysisScoreToActionOptionsScoreWithTanh(double pixelAnalysisScore)
      This method converts the PixelAnalysis score to an ActionOptions score. It is passed to the ContourOps Builder to convert PixelAnalysis scores to ActionOptions scores to be used with matches. Here, we use the tanh function to convert the score to a value between 0 and 1. Tanh(3) ~ 0.995, which is close enough to 1 to be used as the maxScore, and we stretch the values from 0 to 1 to 0 to 3. Tanh(0.87) ~ 0.7, which is the default similarity score used with SikuliX. To maintain the same default similarity score, the minScore is adjusted so that 0.7 corresponds to 0.87 in the tanh function.
      Parameters:
      pixelAnalysisScore - the PixelAnalysis score to convert
      Returns:
      the ActionOptions equivalent of the PixelAnalysis score

    • convertPixelAnalysisScoreToActionOptionsScore

      public double convertPixelAnalysisScoreToActionOptionsScore(double pixelAnalysisScore)

    • getDistBelowThreshhold

      public org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat getDistBelowThreshhold(org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Mat scores, ActionOptions actionOptions)
      Subtract the pixel scores from the threshold. If the pixel score is at or above the threshold, it is set to 0. Low pixel scores, or high scores below the threshold, mean high similarity. This Mat can serve as a mask for other operations that activate pixels below the threshold. For example, pixels that are not similar to any image will be considered no match.
      Parameters:
      scores - the pixel scores
      actionOptions - has minScore, which is converted to the score threshold specific to this class's evaluation method
      Returns:
      the distances from scores to the threshold (0 if >= threshold)
